arts.ttl: Torino’s Vanoli: “The 1-0 cut our legs, we lost against a strong opponent”
arts.sum: Torino manager Paolo Vanoli addressed the media following his team's 2-0 defeat to Bologna at the Stadio Olimpico Grande Torino. The coach expressed disappointment with the result but acknowledged the strength of their opponents. arts.ttl: Serie A | Torino 0-2 Bologna: Match Report
arts.sum: Bologna continued their excellent form in Serie A, securing their sixth win in eight matches with a 2-0 triumph over Torino at the Stadio Olimpico Grande Torino. The victory was sealed by goals from super-sub Thijs Dallinga and Tommaso Pobega, despite an early penalty miss. The post Serie A | Torino 0-2 Bologna: Match Report appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Torino v Bologna opens the Saturday action
arts.sum: Torino have failed to score in three of their last five Serie A matches against Bologna, as many times as in the previous 26; the Granata have failed to score in the two most recent ones and have not gone three games in a row without scoring against the Rossoblu since the period between 1962 and 1963. Ché Adams has scored all four of his Serie A goals for Torino in the second half, three of which as a substitute; the last Granata player to do better in a single championship coming on as a substitute was Andrea Belotti (five in 2021/22).

arts.ttl: Torino’s Vanoli prepares to face Italiano’s Bologna: “He deserves what he’s achieved”
arts.sum: As Torino prepares for their upcoming Serie A match against Bologna, head coach Paolo Vanoli addressed the media in a pre-match press conference. The Granata are looking to build on their recent positive results, having secured four points and two clean sheets in away matches against Genoa and Empoli. The post Torino’s Vanoli prepares to face Italiano’s Bologna: “He deserves what he’s achieved” appeared first on FootItalia.com.
